summary: This is a letter from attorney Nicole Simmons to Judge Nathan, transmitting Ghislaine Maxwell's proposed redactions to her request and reply in support of modifying the protective order in her criminal case. It is a procedural filing in the ongoing legal proceedings.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Author of the letter transmitting Ghislaine Maxwell's proposed redactions to the court.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Requested that the proposed redactions be submitted to the court.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell) whose legal team is submitting proposed redactions to modify the protective order.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The recipient of the letter, the judge presiding over the criminal case.

persons.name: Ann Lundbe
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) of the email correspondence.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) of the email correspondence.

connections.description: Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's legal defense team, as he requested the submission of her proposed redactions.
Simmons is acting at Pagliuca's request to submit documents to the court, indicating they are part of the same legal team or firm.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judge over Maxwell's criminal case.

events.title: Submission of Proposed Redactions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team submits proposed redactions to her request and reply in support of modifying the protective order in her criminal case.

keyFacts: The document is a procedural filing in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team is seeking to modify the protective order governing the case, and is submitting proposed redactions to their filings on the matter.
The correspondence shows the ongoing legal activity and motion practice in Maxwell's case as of August 2020.
